sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"标准"之意。
means: standard ： 指公认为决定事物质量或人的品质的准则或原则。
criterion ： 较正式用词，指判断、批评事物的标准，但不一定制成了规章。
measure与standard基本同义，但多用于比喻，指衡量某事物的质量准则。
gauge ： 专指测量物体大小、厚度、直径等的标准规格。

word_mean: 标准规格：作为尺度或模式的东西，其他类似物皆以此为准
［pressure］ level  由国际协议确定的标准等压面, 如1 000hPa、850hPa 、700hPa等。

sentence.Network_cn: 居民们普遍都很贫穷，受教育程度低，居住条件较差。

lj.lj_ly: he is the only one who has dared raise his standard against her.
lj.lj_ls: 他是唯一敢起来反对她的人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a flag raised on a pole as a rallying point, the authorized exemplar of a unit of measurement, or an upright timber): shortening of Old French estendart, from estendre 'extend'; in sense3, influenced by the verb stand

entry.def: A standard is a level of quality or achievement, especially a level that is thought to be acceptable.

example.ex: The standard of professional cricket has never been lower...
example.tran: 职业板球的水平从来没有这么低过。

example.ex: There will be new national standards for hospital cleanliness.
example.tran: 有关医院清洁的新国家标准将会出台。

entry.def: A standard is something that you use in order to judge the quality of something else.

example.ex: ...systems that were by later standards absurdly primitive.
example.tran: 以后来的标准来衡量显得非常原始的系统

entry.def: Standards are moral principles which affect people's attitudes and behaviour.

example.ex: My father has always had high moral standards.
example.tran: 我父亲一直具有很高的道德准则。

entry.def: You use standard to describe things which are usual and normal.

example.ex: It was standard practice for untrained clerks to advise in serious cases such as murder...
example.tran: 让未经过训练的书记员在诸如谋杀等重大案件中提供建议是普遍的做法。

example.ex: No other executive car can offer you the same level of standard equipment at this price.
example.tran: 再无其他高级轿车能按这个价格水平为你提供同样水准的标准配置。

entry.tran: (作品等)受广泛阅读的，最受推崇的，最具权威性的
entry.def: A standard work or text on a particular subject is one that is widely read and often recommended.

means.word_mean: 1. a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated;

sentences.sentence: "they set the measure for all subsequent work"

means.word_mean: 2. the ideal in terms of which something can be judged;

sentences.sentence: "they live by the standards of their community"

means.word_mean: 4. the value behind the money in a monetary system
5. an upright pole or beam (especially one used as a support);

sentences.sentence: "distance was marked by standards every mile"

means.word_mean: 1. conforming to or constituting a standard of measurement or value; or of the usual or regularized or accepted kind;
3. established or widely recognized as a model of authority or excellence;
4. conforming to the established language usage of educated native speakers;

sentences.sentence: "received standard English is sometimes called the King's English" (British)

means.word_mean: 5. regularly and widely used or sold;

stems_affixes.word_buile: stagn=stan站,立+ant……的→站着不走,停滞的
stand确立+ard→n. 标准, 规格 adj.标准的
stead=stand[v.站, 立, 站起]+fast→稳固的
dis分开+stance=stan站,立→分开站着→有距离→距离
equi平等+distance[n.距离, 远离]→n.等距离
home家+stead=stand[v.站, 立, 站起]→站再家里的→处在家的→家园,家宅
in内+stan站,立+ce→站在里面的东西,表示就在面前→例子
stand确立+ard→n. 标准, 规格 adj.标准的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 站立, 身分, 名望, 持续
stems_affixes.word_buile: stand[v.站, 立, 站起]+ing状态→n.站立, 身分, 名望, 持续
stand[v.站, 立, 站起]+point点→n.立场, 观点

stems_affixes.value_cn: 物质;实质,本质;主旨;财产,资产
stems_affixes.word_buile: sub下面+stance=stan站,立→放在下面之物
stan站,立+d→v.站, 立, 站起

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使符合标准, 使标准化
stems_affixes.word_buile: standard[n. 标准, 规格 adj.标准的]+ize表动词→v.使符合标准, 使标准化

Sentence.sentence: While the emphasis on teaching to higher, test-driven standards as set in No Child Left Behind resulted in significantly better performance in elementary(and some middle)schools, high schools for a variety of reasons seemed to have made little progress.
Students have to meet higher academic standards
Apple's products were designed to accord with the boss's tastes and to meet his extremely high standards.
Standard & Poor's and Moody's Investors Service rate the level of risk of many corporate and government bonds.
There is no standard for a person with alcoholism.
Rising population combined with improved nutrition standards and shifting dietary preferences will exert pressure for increases in global food supply

means.word_mean: 标准, 水准, 规范

sentences.en: The standard of length in France is the metre.

means.word_mean: 平均质量; 业务水平

sentences.en: The people of the US have a high standard of living.
sentences.cn: 美国人民的生活水平很高。

sentences.en: Two men carried the standard in the royal parade.
sentences.cn: 在盛大的游行队伍中, 两个男子打着旗子。

sentences.en: The deck will need six standards to make it secure.
sentences.cn: 这座平台要用六根支柱才能稳固。

jushi.english: The design is of very high standard.
The book is a standard among young people.
jushi.chinese: 这是一本在青年人中流行的必读书。

jushi.english: This fight for better living standards is increasingly on the agenda of the people.
jushi.chinese: 这种为更高生活水平而进行的奋斗已越来越多地提到了人们的议事日程上。
